explanation:
1) struct linux_driver (full definition): Needed to verify that sdrv, drv_name and mod_name are fields of the object pointed to by the parameter ldrv. This distinguishes modifying the pointee (allowed by the MISRA rule) from modifying the parameter variable itself (disallowed). The field types (e.g. whether drv_name/mod_name are char * or something else) are relevant to understand how they are passed to sysfs_open_driver/snprintf.

2) struct linux_bus (full definition): Needed to confirm bus_name is a member of the object pointed to by lbus and to ensure that the code only reads lbus->bus_name (not reassigning lbus itself). This confirms whether any observed writes affect the parameter variable or only the pointee.

3) sysfs_open_driver (declaration/prototype and brief semantics): Needed to determine its parameter and return types and whether it modifies any of the passed objects or takes non-const pointer-to-pointer parameters that could cause modification of the pointer parameters (lbus or ldrv). Knowing whether sysfs_open_driver writes through any of its arguments is required to decide if the target function is modifying parameter variables versus permitted modification of pointees.
